title: Four healthcare projects by Flad Architects: Your Next Employer?
author: Niall Patrick Walsh
excerpt: Following our previous visit to STUDIO V Architecture, we are moving our Meet Your Next Employer series to Raleigh, NC this week to explore the work of Flad Architects. A multidisciplinary firm with ten offices across the United States, Flad Architects describes its ethos as...
text: Following our previous visit to STUDIO V Architecture, we are moving our Meet Your Next Employer series to Raleigh, NC this week to explore the work of Flad Architects. A multidisciplinary firm with ten offices across the United States, Flad Architects describes its ethos as “committed to creating environments that enhance human potential.” While Flad’s portfolio spans several disciplines and typologies, the firm specializes particularly in projects addressing healthcare, education, and science. Last month, meanwhile, Archinect covered the firm’s success at the AIA San Francisco Design Awards.  Over on Archinect Jobs, the firm is currently hiring for several positions, including a Director of Healthcare to join their Raleigh team. For candidates interested in applying for a position or anybody interested in learning more about the firm’s output, we have rounded up four healthcare projects by Flad Architects that exemplify the firm’s ethos. Novartis. Image courtesy of Flad ArchitectsNovartis, Holly Springs, NC For vaccine company Novartis, Flad Architects designed a quality control, testing, and administration facility to support the company’s ability to produce up to 150 million doses of influenza vaccine within six months of a pandemic declaration. The scheme includes laboratories designed for rapid conversion to higher production standards, enabling flexibility in response to health emergencies. Shared amenities such as a central entrance, dining area, conference rooms, and training spaces are meanwhile designed to support operational efficiency and interdepartmental communication. Learn more on Novartis’ Archinect project page Novartis. Image courtesy of Flad ArchitectsNovartis. Image courtesy of Flad ArchitectsBiochemical Sciences Complex, University of Wisconsin, Madison, WI The second phase of the Biochemical Sciences Complex at the University of Wisconsin is a 250,000-square-foot teaching and research facility serving the Biochemistry Department. The scheme brings together undergraduates, graduate students, and staff from the College of Agricultural and Life Sciences and the Medical School. Designed to support interdisciplinary collaboration, the facility includes laboratories for 20 research groups, instructional labs, classrooms, auditoria, administrative areas, and offices for the National Nuclear Magnetic Resonance Structural Database initiative. The project’s design seeks to preserve the campus’s architectural character by incorporating historic facades. Learn more on the Biochemical Sciences Complex’s Archinect project page Biochemical Sciences Complex, University of Wisconsin. Image courtesy of Flad ArchitectsBiochemical Sciences Complex, University of Wisconsin. Image courtesy of Flad ArchitectsSt. Mary’s Emergency Center, Sun Prairie, WI St. Mary’s Emergency Center is Wisconsin’s first freestanding emergency care facility, designed to improve response time and trauma care accessibility. The center includes medical imaging services, a laboratory, a drive-through ambulance bay, and a helicopter transport area. To support pediatric care, the facility incorporates child-friendly design elements, including a fire-truck-themed environment. The project aims to deliver timely, high-quality emergency services while reducing patient stress through interior design moves. Learn more on the St. Mary’s Emergency Center’s Archinect project page St. Mary’s Emergency Center. Image courtesy of Flad ArchitectsSt. Mary’s Emergency Center. Image courtesy of Flad ArchitectsUniversity of Wisconsin Medical Foundation Centennial Building, Madison, WI The University of Wisconsin Medical Foundation Centennial Building is a faculty office facility designed to support the integration of the medical school and public health department. Accommodating up to twelve departments, the building provides flexible office space that promotes collaboration while preserving individual departmental identities. The design responds to its context, using materials such as brick, stone, and curtain wall to align aesthetically with nearby structures, including the adjacent academic medical center and the historic 1836 Keystone House. Learn more on the University of Wisconsin Medical Foundation’s Archinect project page University of Wisconsin Medical Foundation Centennial Building. Image courtesy of Flad ArchitectsUniversity of Wisconsin Medical Foundation Centennial Building. Image courtesy of Flad ArchitectsMeet Your Next Employer is one of a number of ongoing weekly series showcasing the opportunities available on our industry-leading job board. Our Job Highlights series looks at intriguing and topical employment opportunities currently available on Archinect Jobs, while our weekly roundups curate job opportunities by location, career level, and job description.
html:
Following our previous visit to STUDIO V Architecture, we are moving our Meet Your Next Employer series to Raleigh, NC this week to explore the work of Flad Architects.

A multidisciplinary firm with ten offices across the United States, Flad Architects describes its ethos as “committed to creating environments that enhance human potential.” While Flad’s portfolio spans several disciplines and typologies, the firm specializes particularly in projects addressing healthcare, education, and science. Last month, meanwhile, Archinect covered the firm’s success at the AIA San Francisco Design Awards. 

Over on Archinect Jobs, the firm is currently hiring for several positions, including a Director of Healthcare to join their Raleigh team. For candidates interested in applying for a position or anybody interested in learning more about the firm’s output, we have rounded up four healthcare projects by Flad Architects that exemplify the firm’s ethos.

Novartis, Holly Springs, NC

For vaccine company Novartis, Flad Architects designed a quality control, testing, and administration facility to support the company’s ability to produce up to 150 million doses of influenza vaccine within six months of a pandemic declaration. The scheme includes laboratories designed for rapid conversion to higher production standards, enabling flexibility in response to health emergencies. Shared amenities such as a central entrance, dining area, conference rooms, and training spaces are meanwhile designed to support operational efficiency and interdepartmental communication.

Learn more on Novartis’ Archinect project page

Biochemical Sciences Complex, University of Wisconsin, Madison, WI

The second phase of the Biochemical Sciences Complex at the University of Wisconsin is a 250,000-square-foot teaching and research facility serving the Biochemistry Department. The scheme brings together undergraduates, graduate students, and staff from the College of Agricultural and Life Sciences and the Medical School. Designed to support interdisciplinary collaboration, the facility includes laboratories for 20 research groups, instructional labs, classrooms, auditoria, administrative areas, and offices for the National Nuclear Magnetic Resonance Structural Database initiative. The project’s design seeks to preserve the campus’s architectural character by incorporating historic facades.

Learn more on the Biochemical Sciences Complex’s Archinect project page

St. Mary’s Emergency Center, Sun Prairie, WI

St. Mary’s Emergency Center is Wisconsin’s first freestanding emergency care facility, designed to improve response time and trauma care accessibility. The center includes medical imaging services, a laboratory, a drive-through ambulance bay, and a helicopter transport area. To support pediatric care, the facility incorporates child-friendly design elements, including a fire-truck-themed environment. The project aims to deliver timely, high-quality emergency services while reducing patient stress through interior design moves.

Learn more on the St. Mary’s Emergency Center’s Archinect project page

University of Wisconsin Medical Foundation Centennial Building, Madison, WI

The University of Wisconsin Medical Foundation Centennial Building is a faculty office facility designed to support the integration of the medical school and public health department. Accommodating up to twelve departments, the building provides flexible office space that promotes collaboration while preserving individual departmental identities. The design responds to its context, using materials such as brick, stone, and curtain wall to align aesthetically with nearby structures, including the adjacent academic medical center and the historic 1836 Keystone House.

Learn more on the University of Wisconsin Medical Foundation’s Archinect project page

Meet Your Next Employer is one of a number of ongoing weekly series showcasing the opportunities available on our industry-leading job board. Our Job Highlights series looks at intriguing and topical employment opportunities currently available on Archinect Jobs, while our weekly roundups curate job opportunities by location, career level, and job description.
